posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Welcome to the guild Krankui!

About the build you consider to play, nobody is more expert to say that but yourself. You seem to me a bit undecided but also afraid if the build you would like to play will be good in PvP. The build you linked by "DragonRaider" is very tight in it's stracture, you have to accept it as it is, or play something else. IIf your world has an easy leveling then i would advice you to just accept it as it is, but if leveling takes normal time or more then you might want to consider playing something else. We really cannot give you good advice though without more details about the PW that you play, especially if this is for PvP, changes to classes, feats and ablities are very important to know. Is devastating critical allowed? Any changes to Heal/Harm spells? HiPS are modified? All these and more are very important information for getting a really strong build for PvP. So, give us more informatiion and i am sure we are going to help you find a good build to play and enjoy!

posts.author: Krankui
posts.content:
Thank you for your response!

- Harm and heal are capped at 250 max dmg/heal

Ok so thats the changes in feats/spells. To make this easier I decided to go monk way beacause already have a monk halfling (-2 STR, +2 DEX, +2CON here) with the following stats:
STR 10
DEX 18
CON 14
INT 14
WIS 14

It's level 5 now with dodge and weapon finesse for the feats and + 1 DEX picked at level 4. The idea is to make this monk/shadowdancer/Champion of Torm, but I dont know if picking CoT is worth? posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
And now i will try to answer some of your questions as best as i can,

1) If your main concern is PvP then CoT save bonusses are useful only when players do something to you that you need to save for. If there is not Dev, Critical and players don't use many spells then you probably do not need the saves that CoT gives you and you are better with Fighter instead. Take these with a grain of salt as i do not know how PvP is working in your server, for example if there are KD immune items in abudance then you obviously need to change the feats of your builds to IDS maybe and stuff like that. Items change as many things if not more for a build, than the changes in feats and skills and you have to take them into careful consideration if you want to be successful in PvP.

2) Monk's "Empty Body" ability is quite useful indeed, as it is long duration (for PvP) and cannot be dispelled, ergo is good to have it.

3) Consider another way also to make a build, if your server is a +5 maxed PW and the AC's aren't so high as to make the PvP battles a "rolling the most twenty's fest", then a really high AB build with WM preferably, will probably eat them alive before they can even react. A "Scyther" with 50 AB, might be a big surprise to them if they expect all dexterity builds.

posts.author: Krankui
posts.content: Hey on second thought and testing things i decided to give up DEX builds. The reasons are painful leveling and too low dmg output in my server environment. So I hit on an idea of creating bard 16/ fighter 14/ rdd 10. This build looks so strong and solid. I can pull very high AC and even higher with imp. expertise, AB is so good too, and with provoke/curse song/bard song is even better. I'm able to cast V level spells in armour so full plate is not a problem. DMG output is enormous with warhammer/battle axe (its probably better since it can be the target of keen spell). I have only one doubt about last epic feat I should get. Is it better to get epic skill focus taunt or concentration? I dont really know how does taunt work. is it taunt skill + d20 against concentration skillonly (with no roll) then I'm pretty sure taking concentration is a better option. Am I right?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Yes, (Ftr/ Bard/ Rdd) builds are one of the strongest options there is.

Taunt, is an opposed skill check so you always want to have as higher " Taunt " skill as you can. Without a doubt you should select Esf: Taunt as your Epic feat of choice.
